Hi, Tim!
I lived with this problem about a half a year, too. I found 2
work=
-arrounds:
1. To add to any test class little main that will run JUnit. Tha=
t is
don't use eclipse's plugin, but directly JUnit. In this way you can
ru=
n precisely one method or whatever you want programmatically.
2. In my ecli=
pse (more precisely in my version of the JUnit plugin of
eclipse, I see myT=
estMethodName[i], where i>=3D1, but for i=3D0 I see
myTestMethodName. So, I=
 can rerun this method easily.

I think it is problem of the JUnit plugin a=
nd not JUnit itself.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "timdiggins" <subscribe=
d@...> wrote:
>
> Hi -
> 
> I'm using @RunWith(org.junit.runners.Parameteri=
zed.class) to have
> parameterized tests.
> 
> Tests run (and fail) fine. b=
ut when the error is reported it is
> reported as myTestMethodName[0] or my=
TestMethodName[1] (according to
> which parameter was used.
> 
> This is fi=
ne for display, but unfortunately when Eclipse wants to find
> the test, it=
 is using this name and so if you double click on a
> success/failure, ecli=
pse will complain with "Can't find method
> 'myTestMethodName[0]' opening t=
est class instead".
> 
> It's not that important - I have been living with =
this for about a
> year (!), but finally wondered hey - let's ask around if=
 there's an
> obvious workaround (a way to overide the test name in the tes=
t) or a
> way to fix this... I'd rather not patch my local junit.
> 
> (No =
mention of this in the forums or elsewhere AFAIK).
> 
> thanks 
> 
> Tim
>
